basic.description: This course is part of a two-semester sequence emphasizing the physiochemical role of carbohydrates, lipids, and proteins in metabolic pathways; their integration and regulation; bases for determining requirements for energy- yielding nutrients and energy and dietary standards; cell growth and body  composition.
basic.subject: HUN
basic.title: Intermediary Metabolism of Nutrients I

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: CHM 2200C and HUN 1201 with a grade of "B-" or better.
